alert.note: Alert for South Central Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 9:16PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washington County through 1015 PM MDT... At 914 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Washington, or 20 miles northeast of Virgin River Gorge, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, St George, Washington, Hurricane, Santa Clara, La Verkin, New Harmony, Dameron Valley, Quail Creek State Park, Sand Hollow State Park, Gunlock State Park, Ivins, Toquerville, Leeds, Virgin, Pintura, Bloomington, Pine Valley, Gunlock and Veyo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 41. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 0 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
